latest news.eng_title: Morgan Stanley keeps Tesla stock target, overweight rating on energy growth
latest news.summary: Morgan Stanley has maintained its Overweight rating on Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) shares with a price target of $310.00, citing the potential indirect benefits to Tesla's energy segment from rising greenhouse gas emissions from global data centers. The firm's analysis suggests that emissions from data centers are expected to grow significantly, with an estimated increase of around 2.5 billion tonnes by 2030. Morgan Stanley points out the irony in the situation where automakers like Ford (NYSE:F) are purchasing Zero Emission Vehicle (ZEV) credits to comply with global CO2 emissions standards, which may end up funding Tesla's expansion of energy-intensive AI data centers. Tesla's AI infrastructure had a reported value of $2.5 billion within its property, plant, and equipment (PP&E) at the end of the second quarter of 2024, marking a 65% increase year-over-year. The company's stock price has shown resilience and potential for growth despite the complexities of the automotive and tech industries' transition to lower-emission technologies, with a 23.27% price total return over the last three months.
latest news.title: Morgan Stanley keeps Tesla stock target, overweight rating on energy growth

latest news.eng_title: Tesla Stock Price Reaches 200 Euro, But Bernstein Remains Skeptical
latest news.summary: Tesla's stock price has surpassed the 200 Euro mark, reaching 206.50 Euros. However, the company is not immune to negative news. Bernstein has downgraded its rating to 'underperform' and set a price target of 120 Dollars, which would result in a 50% loss for the stock. Bernstein analysts believe the company's value is around 360 Billion Dollars, citing the high price-to-earnings ratio of 118. Analysts are more optimistic, seeing the trend as weak but improving. As Bernstein analyst said, 'the trend is still too weak'.
latest news.title: Tesla-Aktie: Der Bernstein-Schock!

latest news.eng_title: Tesla (TSLA) Exceeds Market Returns: Some Facts to Consider
latest news.summary: Tesla (TSLA) closed at $227.87, a 0.48% increase from the previous day's close. This outpaced the S&P 500's 0.03% gain and the Dow's 0.04% loss. Over the past month, Tesla's shares have gained 1.82%, lagging the Auto-Tires-Trucks sector's 1.96% gain but outpacing the S&P 500's 1.54% gain. Analysts expect Tesla to report earnings of $0.58 per share, a 12.12% year-over-year decline, and revenue of $25.73 billion, a 10.18% increase from the previous year. The Zacks Consensus Estimates forecast earnings of $2.27 per share and revenue of $98.9 billion for the entire year, indicating changes of -27.24% and +2.19%, respectively. The Zacks Rank system, which takes estimate changes into account, has a track record of outperforming, with stocks rated #1 producing an average annual return of +25%. Tesla currently has a Zacks Rank of #3 (Hold) and a Forward P/E ratio of 99.9, which is a premium compared to its industry. The PEG ratio is 4.62, higher than the average PEG ratio for the Automotive - Domestic industry.
latest news.title: Tesla (TSLA) Exceeds Market Returns: Some Facts to Consider

latest news.eng_title: TSLA, AMD, or PLTR: Which Growth Stock Is the Best Pick?
latest news.summary: Wall Street analysts have compared Tesla (TSLA), Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), and Palantir (PLTR) to determine the best growth stock. Tesla has seen a 5% increase in shares over the past month but is still down 9% year-to-date due to slowing EV demand and rising competition. AMD has risen only 3.2% in 2022 compared to Nvidia's 136% rally, but analysts are optimistic about AMD's ability to capture generative AI demand with its MI300X AI chip. Palantir has rallied 111% driven by solid financials and optimism about its Artificial Intelligence Platform (AIP). Analysts are highly bullish about AMD stock, but sidelined on Tesla and Palantir stocks. The average AMD stock price target is $190.25, implying 25.1% upside potential, while the average TSLA and PLTR stock price targets are $208.98 and $27.08 respectively, indicating possible down sides of 8% and 25.4%.
latest news.title: TSLA, AMD, or PLTR: Which Growth Stock Is the Best Pick?

latest news.eng_title: Why Tesla Stock is Worth $295, According to Wall Street's Newest Bull
latest news.summary: Tesla's stock has underperformed the broader markets in the last three years, but has still returned more than 14,000% to shareholders since going public in 2010. Despite slower growth, falling margins, and a challenging macro environment, Deutsche Bank is bullish on Tesla, rating it a 'buy' with a target price of $295. Analyst Edison Yu believes Tesla should be valued as a technology platform, not just an automaker, and is particularly bullish on its battery storage business, which could generate $13 billion in sales by 2025. Tesla is also expected to report double-digit vehicle delivery growth in China in Q3 of 2024 and is on track to unveil its robotaxi on Oct. 10, which could disrupt the multi-billion-dollar ride-hailing market.
latest news.title: Why Tesla Stock is Worth $295, According to Wall Street's Newest Bull

latest news.summary: Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) shares traded 2.3% higher during mid-day trading on Tuesday, reaching a high of $234.57 and closing at $231.99. The company's market capitalization is $725.16 billion, with a price-to-earnings ratio of 59.18 and a beta of 2.29. Analysts have set a consensus target price of $209.60, with 9 rating the stock 'sell', 17 rating it 'hold', and 13 rating it 'buy'. The company's revenue for the quarter was $25.50 billion, missing analysts' expectations of $24.38 billion. Tesla's return on equity is 10.41% and its net margin is 13.00%. Insider selling has been reported, with SVP Xiaotong Zhu selling 297 shares on September 6th and Director Robyn M. Denholm selling 66,364 shares on July 25th. Institutional investors have also been active, with Atalanta Sosnoff Capital LLC increasing its stake in Tesla by 3.7% in the fourth quarter and Newbridge Financial Services Group Inc. lifting its holdings in shares of Tesla by 7.4% during the same period.
latest news.title: Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) Trading 2.3% Higher

latest news.eng_title: Monetta Financial Services Inc. Purchases New Position in Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA)
latest news.summary: Monetta Financial Services Inc. has acquired a new position in Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) with 4,500 shares valued at approximately $890,000. Other institutional investors and hedge funds have also modified their holdings of the stock, with Strategic Financial Concepts LLC increasing its position by 21,816.0% and Vanguard Group Inc. increasing its stake by 1.7%. Denholm sold 66,364 shares of the firm's stock in a transaction dated Thursday, July 25th, and SVP Xiaotong Zhu sold 297 shares of the stock in a transaction on Friday, September 6th.
latest news.title: Monetta Financial Services Inc. Purchases New Position in Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA)

latest news.eng_title: Intel, Microsoft, Meta Platforms, Pfizer, Tesla: Why These 5 Stocks Are On Investors' Radars Today
latest news.summary: On Monday, major U.S. indices showed mixed results. Intel shares surged by 6.36% to close at $20.91, after reports that the company could receive up to $3 billion in federal funding to produce semiconductors for U.S. military applications. Microsoft shares saw a slight increase of 0.17% to close at $431.34, after announcing a new share repurchase program worth up to $60 billion and declaring a quarterly dividend of $0.83 per share. Meta Platforms shares rose by 1.75% to close at $533.28, after deciding to use U.K. Facebook and Instagram posts to train its AI systems. Pfizer shares increased by 2.73% to close at $30.07, despite concerns from Florida about the safety of mRNA vaccines. Tesla shares dropped by 1.54% to close at $226.74, after electric vehicle registrations in July in the U.S. marked an 18% increase compared to the same month last year.
latest news.title: Intel, Microsoft, Meta Platforms, Pfizer, Tesla: Why These 5 Stocks Are On Investors' Radars Today

latest news.eng_title: U.S. Stocks Close Mixed Ahead Of Fed Policy Meeting; Dow Hits New Record High
latest news.summary: U.S. stocks closed mixed on Monday as investors awaited the Federal Reserve's monetary policy announcement later this week. The Dow hit a new record high, closing up 228.30 points or 0.55 percent at 41,622.08, while the Nasdaq closed lower by 91.85 points or 0.52 percent at 17,592.13. The S&P 500 settled at 5,633.09 with a small gain of 7.07 points or 0.13 percent. Oracle Corporation climbed more than 5 percent, and several other stocks such as Meta Platforms, Accenture, and Cisco Systems also closed notably higher. On the other hand, Tesla, Broadcom, and Adobe Inc. ended with sharp to moderate losses. The Federal Reserve Bank of New York released a report showing regional manufacturing grew for the first time in nearly a year in the month of September, with the general business conditions index surging to a positive 11.5 from a negative 4.7 in August.
latest news.title: U.S. Stocks Close Mixed Ahead Of Fed Policy Meeting; Dow Hits New Record High

news knowledge.summary: Tesla's (NASDAQ:TSLA) shares declined by 0.5% on Friday, trading as low as $226.32 and closing at $228.73. Analysts have downgraded the stock, with New Street Research changing its rating from 'buy' to 'neutral' with a target price of $225.00. Other analysts, such as TD Cowen and HSBC, have also adjusted their price targets, with TD Cowen increasing its target from $160.00 to $180.00. Despite this, the company's revenue was up 2.3% compared to the same quarter last year, with the company earning $0.52 EPS, missing analysts' consensus estimates of $0.62. In other news, Director Robyn M. Denholm sold 66,364 shares of Tesla stock, and SVP Xiaotong Zhu sold 297 shares. Company insiders own 25.10% of the company's stock, and hedge funds have made changes to their positions in the stock, with FIDELIS iM LLC buying a new position in shares of Tesla.
news knowledge.title: Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA)  Shares Down 0.5%

Denholm sold 66,364 shares of the company's stock, valued at approximately $14,597,425.44.
news knowledge.title: Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) Trading 2.6% Higher

news knowledge.eng_title: 'US Stocks' Closing Report: Nonfarm payrolls fell 4.5%
news knowledge.summary: US stocks had a poor start to September, with nonfarm payrolls falling 4.5%. Tesla shares plummeted over 8%, while Huida's market value reached a record high in just one week. The S&P recorded its worst week since 2023. According to International Business Times, a Goldman Sachs technical expert who has made the most accurate predictions this year has turned bearish on US stocks, advising investors not to chase highs or lows in the turbulent international market. As Apple prepares to release the iPhone 16, investors are looking to the company as a potential source of hope for the market.
news knowledge.title: 'US Stocks' Closing Report: Nonfarm payrolls fell 4.5%

news knowledge.eng_title: US Stock Markets Close with Mixed Results, Tesla's Stock Price Surges
news knowledge.summary: US stock markets closed with mixed results on Wednesday: while the Dow Jones gained 0.1%, the Nasdaq 100 lost 0.2%. The phase of significant losses seems to be over. The Dow Jones Industrial Average ended the trading day with a gain of 0.1% at 40,974 points, bringing the 41,000-point mark within reach. The technology-heavy Nasdaq 100 lost 0.2% to 18,921 points. The best Dow performers were Travelers, IBM, and Boeing, each gaining around 1%. Intel and Amazon, on the other hand, were weaker. Tesla's stock price surged 4.18%, increasing the company's market value to $687 billion. This represents a gain of $28 billion, equivalent to the market value of Bayer. On Thursday, Broadcom will release its quarterly earnings. The US Federal Reserve may lower interest rates by 0.5% on September 18. Some market observers expect this, citing the weak US jobs report. Ulrich Stephan, Chief Investment Strategist at Deutsche Bank, comments, 'In an immediate reaction to the interest rate term markets, a robust interest rate cut of 0.5% was priced in for the US Federal Reserve meeting in September with a 50% probability.' The DAX continued to decline, closing 0.83% lower at 18,591 points. The MDAX of mid-cap companies fell 0.43% to 25,296 points.
news knowledge.title: Vorgaben für deutsche Börse: US-Märkte stoppen hohe Verluste, Tesla-Aktie legt rasant zu

The phase of significant losses appears to be over. Tesla's stock price rose 4.18%, increasing the company's market value to $687 billion. This represents a gain of $28 billion, equivalent to the market value of Bayer. Ulrich Stephan, Chief Investment Strategist at Deutsche Bank, commented, 'In an immediate reaction to the interest rate term market, a robust interest rate cut of 0.5 percentage points was priced in for the US Federal Reserve meeting in September with a 50% probability.' The DAX fell 0.83% to 18,591, while the MDAX lost 0.43% to 25,296.
news knowledge.title: Vorgaben für deutsche Börse: Tesla-Aktie im Höhenflug, US-Börsen beenden Phase hoher Verluste

news knowledge.eng_title: Watch These Tesla Price Levels as Stock Tries to Jumpstart Rally
news knowledge.summary: Tesla shares jumped 4.2% on Wednesday, closing at $219.41, despite a broader downturn in large-cap technology stocks. According to technical analysis, investors should watch for several key price levels: a breakout above the symmetrical triangle and downtrend line could see shares rally to $265, while further buying could drive a move up to $300. A breakdown below the triangle could see an initial fall to $185, and ongoing weakness may spark a decline to $152, where bargain hunters may look for buying opportunities near the April 2023 swing low.
news knowledge.title: Watch These Tesla Price Levels as Stock Tries to Jumpstart Rally

news knowledge.eng_title: What Next After Tesla Stock Dropped 6% In A Day
news knowledge.summary: Tesla stock (NASDAQ;TSLA) declined by 6% in a day, closing at $211 per share. The decline is attributed to BMW beating Tesla in EV deliveries in Europe for July and Tesla's Vice President of Finance resigning from the company. This is the latest in a series of top executive departures, which could be negatively impacting the stock. Looking at a longer time period, TSLA stock has seen a decline of 10% from $235 in early January 2021 to around $210 now, while the S&P 500 has increased by 50% over the same period. However, the decrease in TSLA stock has been far from consistent, with returns of 50% in 2021, -65% in 2022, and 102% in 2023. The Trefis High Quality (HQ) Portfolio, with a collection of 30 stocks, has outperformed the S&P 500 each year over the same period. Tesla's recent performance has been a mixed bag, with a nearly 7% year-over-year decline in automotive revenue and a 42% drop in earnings. However, the company's energy business has been a bright spot, with storage and energy sales doubling from the previous year. We value Tesla stock at $230 per share, which is slightly ahead of the current market price.
news knowledge.title: What Next After Tesla Stock Dropped 6% In A Day

news knowledge.eng_title: European Stock Markets Close with Gains, Powell Calls for Monetary Policy Adjustment
news knowledge.summary: The European stock markets closed with significant gains on Friday. Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell stated in his highly anticipated speech at the Central Bankers' Forum in Jackson Hole that the time for monetary policy adjustment has arrived. Inflation has decreased significantly, while a strong increase in unemployment should be avoided, according to Powell. The timing and pace of interest rate cuts are data-dependent. The markets are praising a potential first interest rate cut by the US Federal Reserve in September. The DAX closed with a gain of 0.8% at 18,633 points, with the all-time high of 18,893 points within reach. The Euro Stoxx 50 rose by 0.5% to 4,909 points. Nestle's CEO Mark Schneider has been replaced by Laurent Freixe, who will take over as CEO on September 1. The company's shares rose by 0.1%. Infineon has agreed with the insolvency administrator of Qimonda on a settlement, ending a long-standing lawsuit. The company will pay 753.5 million euros, while Infineon will take the formed provisions into account. The shares of Infineon rose by 0.3%. The shares of Infas Holding rose by 62.7% to 6.80 euros after an acquisition offer. BMW has surpassed Tesla as the leading seller of electric vehicles in the EU, according to UBS analyst Patrick Hummel. The shares of BMW rose by 1.5%, while Tesla's shares fell by 1.2%. Evotec's shares rose by 6.7% after a 'buy' recommendation by RBC and recent stock purchases by the company's board members. Hugo Boss's shares rose by 5.2% after Frasers Group reportedly asked the cartel office for permission to increase its stake in the company.
news knowledge.title: MÄRKTE EUROPA/Powell gibt grünes Licht für Börsenrally - Nestle-CEO geht

news knowledge.eng_title: Tesla Ends Down 12.3%, Sees Largest Percent Decrease Since September 2020 — Data Talk Update
news knowledge.summary: Tesla, Inc. (TSLA) closed at $215.99, down 12.33% or $30.39, marking its largest percent decrease since September 2020. The stock has been down three of the past four days, with a two-day decline of 14.12%. This is the worst two-day stretch since November 2021. Despite being down 13.08% year-to-date, Tesla is up 9.15% month-to-date. The company's stock has fallen 47.32% from its all-time closing high and 21.75% from its 52-week closing high.
news knowledge.title: Tesla Ends Down 12.3%, Sees Largest Percent Decrease Since September 2020 — Data Talk Update
